reviews.text: Pleasant small station with a basic amenities including a ticket machine. The toilets are a bit grotty, however they are fairly clean. The rail links to Birmingham and Worcester are great!

a very rare arrangement that just possibly may be much more widely adopted in the future, generating a wide range of novel engineering solutions. If that does happen, then they should put up a plaque, and other interpretive mterial! Or even if it doesn't!

Nice little station but could do with ticket barriers to stop people traveling for free and the conductors should do something about this especially on the first train service personally i think all stations should have ticket barriers

I had to go to the QE hospital from Stourbridge junction to moor at and then new street to QE.as I'm disabled and use my mobility scooter I decided to go by train instead of car.
The service is amazing.someone gets you on with a ramp and someone is there waiting for you at your destination.it was a very pleasant journey thank you British rail.WELL DONE!!!

Step free access to all platforms is available here with lifts and has parking and good connections with the Stourbridge shuttle service. Trains are frequent enough towards Birmingham though the station is a bit baron.
